about.title: CloverPit About
about.description1: In the depths of your consciousness lies CloverPit - the demonic lovechild of Balatro and Buckshot Roulette, a roguelite that traps players in a hell of their own creation. Crafted by the twisted minds at Panik Arcade and unleashed by Future Friends Games, this psychological abyss has consumed over 500,000 souls since its September 2025 awakening, earning the whispered approval of 7,300+ tormented souls.
about.description2: You find yourself locked in a rusty cell with a slot machine and an ATM, suspended above an abyss that hungers for your failure. You must pay off your debt at the end of each round, or fall to ruinâ€”literally! The cursed slot machine before you demands tribute - not in coins, but in your very essence. Each spin is a gamble with your sanity, each loss a step closer to the eternal darkness below.
about.description3: Manipulate the slot machine to earn extra coins. Turn the odds in your favor with various prizes and charms that trigger big big combos, snowballing into a dazzling lucky run. Bend the rules, break the game, and pay off your captor long enough to earn a shot at freedom. This is no mere game - it's a "symphony of madness and despair," where psychological torment meets calculated cruelty.
about.description4: The machine cannot be tamed through luck alone. It must be broken - shattered through forbidden knowledge and corrupted charm synergies. Over 150 cursed artifacts whisper forbidden knowledge, meta-progression systems unlock new ways to suffer, and seeded runs allow you to share your torment with others. Each playthrough reveals new depths of depravity, new combinations that bend reality itself. The question isn't whether you can win, but whether you'll retain enough of yourself to care.

q1.question: What is CloverPit: The Descent?
q1.answer: CloverPit: The Descent is a rogue-lite slot machine horror game that combines psychological torment with strategic gameplay. You're trapped in a rusty cell with a cursed slot machine and must pay off your debt or face eternal damnation.

q2.question: Who developed CloverPit?
q2.answer: CloverPit was developed by Panik Arcade and published by Future Friends Games. It was released in September 2025 and has already consumed over 500,000 souls.

q3.question: What makes CloverPit unique?

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started with CloverPit
gettingStarted.subtitle: Welcome to CloverPit, the rogue-lite slot machine horror game where you must manipulate a sinister slot machine to survive. This comprehensive CloverPit guide will help new players understand the core mechanics and survive their first runs in CloverPit. New to the game? Start with our download page to get the game.

step1.title: Master the Basic Gameplay Cycle
step1.description: At its heart, CloverPit follows a straightforward yet unforgiving pattern: you get 3 attempts to spin the cursed machine, collect sufficient coins to settle your debt, or face the abyss below. Newcomers will quickly learn this harsh reality through trial and error.

step2.title: Study Symbol Economics
step2.description: Each symbol in CloverPit carries its own monetary value. Learning which symbols offer the best returns will guide your charm purchasing decisions and help you determine when to take calculated risks.

keyPoints.title: ðŸ’¡ Key Points
keyPoints.point1: Valuable symbols appear less frequently on the reels
keyPoints.point2: Matching 3 identical symbols yields higher rewards
keyPoints.point3: Golden variations of symbols offer additional bonuses

step3.title: Budget Your Ticket Resources
step3.description: Tickets serve as your primary currency for acquiring charms from the various vending machines scattered throughout CloverPit. How you manage these tickets in the early game will determine whether you can create powerful combinations or find yourself struggling with inferior equipment.

keyPoints.title: ðŸ’¡ Key Points

keyPoints.point2: Reserve funds for premium vending machines

step4.title: Explore Charm Interactions

Your initial playthroughs should prioritize understanding how different charms function and how they can be combined to enhance the slot machine's behavior. beginnerTips.title: Essential CloverPit Beginner Tips
beginnerTips.subtitle: Master these fundamental tips from our CloverPit guide to improve your chances of survival in CloverPit and build a foundation for advanced strategies. For more detailed strategies, read our community blog posts.

tip1.title: Calculate Your Debt Requirements
tip1.description: Before pulling the lever, always review your current debt obligation. This CloverPit guide recommends determining the average amount needed per spin to meet your target, then select charms that will help you achieve this goal reliably. Avoid spinning without a clear payment strategy.

tip2.title: Optimize Your Three-Spin Strategy
tip2.description: Each round in CloverPit provides exactly 3 spins. Resist the temptation to rely on luck for your initial spins. Instead, use the first two spins to build momentum with your charms, reserving the final spin as your decisive attempt when all effects are fully active.

tip3.title: Focus on Economic Stability First
tip3.description: During your initial 2-3 rounds, this CloverPit guide suggests prioritizing charms that directly boost coin generation or multiply your earnings. While flashy combination charms may seem appealing, economic charms provide the foundation you need to survive long enough to utilize more complex strategies later.

tip4.title: Time Your Charm Activations
tip4.description: Numerous charms in CloverPit feature rechargeable abilities triggered by the red button. Coordinate these activations between spins to maximize their effectiveness. Rather than waiting for the perfect moment, use these abilities regularly to maintain consistent performance.

tip5.title: Monitor Symbol Appearance Rates
tip5.description: Observe which symbols appear most commonly on the CloverPit slot machine. This CloverPit guide advises selecting charms that enhance symbols that already appear frequently rather than attempting to manipulate rare symbols into appearing more often.

tip6.title: Leverage Phone Upgrade Opportunities
tip6.description: Between rounds, the ominous toy phone presents permanent upgrade options. This CloverPit guide emphasizes that these enhancements accumulate throughout your run and can significantly alter the odds in your favor. Always select upgrades that synergize with your current charm configuration.

tip7.title: Embrace Failed Runs as Learning
tip7.description: Every death in CloverPit unlocks meta-progression content. This CloverPit guide reminds you not to get frustrated by falling into the pit - each run teaches you charm interactions and brings you closer to unlocking powerful new items for future attempts. Learn about all possible endings and outcomes to understand the full scope of the game.

tip8.title: Shop From Different Vending Machines
tip8.description: CloverPit features multiple vending machines with different inventories and price points. This CloverPit guide notes that higher-cost machines often contain more powerful charms, but sometimes cheaper machines offer better value for building specific strategies.

tip9.title: Accept RNG But Mitigate It
tip9.description: CloverPit has randomness, but skilled players consistently win through smart charm selection and risk management. This CloverPit guide explains that the goal isn't eliminating randomness - it's building such a strong engine that random outcomes don't matter.

tip10.title: Unlock Storage Capacity
tip10.description: The storage unit in CloverPit expands your charm carrying capacity. This CloverPit guide recommends prioritizing unlocking additional storage slots through progression - more charms means more powerful synergy combinations in later rounds.

tip11.title: Recognize When to Pivot Your Build
tip11.description: Sometimes the charms offered by vending machines in CloverPit don't match your planned strategy. This CloverPit guide teaches that skilled players adapt to available options rather than forcing a specific build. Flexibility often beats stubbornness.

tip12.title: Study Successful Runs
tip12.description: When you complete a successful run in CloverPit, take note of which charm combinations worked well. This CloverPit guide mentions that the CloverPit community also shares powerful seeds - try these to learn winning strategies from experienced players. Share your own strategies in our community blog.

advancedStrategies.subtitle: Once you've mastered the basics of CloverPit, these advanced strategies from our CloverPit guide will help you push deeper into runs and achieve higher scores. For the latest strategies and updates, check our blog regularly.

symbolControl.title: Advanced Symbol Control
symbolControl.description: Expert CloverPit gameplay requires actively controlling which symbols appear on the reels. This CloverPit guide shows that rather than accepting random outcomes, utilize charms that enhance specific symbol frequencies, generate golden variations, or eliminate undesirable symbols.

implementation.title: Implementation Approach:
implementation.point1: Locate high-value symbols that appear with moderate frequency
implementation.point2: Accumulate charms that specifically enhance these symbols
implementation.point3: Employ removal charms to clear low-value symbol interference
implementation.point4: Generate golden variants to secure bonus rewards

economicGrowth.title: Exponential Economic Growth
economicGrowth.description: The most dependable CloverPit approach centers on creating exponential economic expansion. This CloverPit guide demonstrates how to construct a system that produces surplus coins early, reinvest those profits into more potent charms, and establish a compounding effect that renders later rounds effortless.

principles.title: Core Principles:
principles.point1: Exceed debt requirements early to access superior charms
principles.point2: Allocate tickets to economic multipliers before decorative effects
principles.point3: Phone upgrades that enhance ticket income accumulate over time
principles.point4: By rounds 5-6, you should possess dominant economic superiority

reactionChains.title: Creating Reaction Chains
reactionChains.description: Some of the most formidable CloverPit configurations center on charm combinations that initiate cascading effects. This CloverPit guide reveals that when charm A activates charm B, which then triggers charm C, you create explosive turns that produce enormous payouts from apparently simple spins.

guidelines.title: Chain Construction Guidelines:
guidelines.point1: Seek "when X occurs" trigger conditions on charms
guidelines.point2: Combine charms that establish the conditions other charms require
guidelines.point3: Accumulate multiple charms that activate from the same event
guidelines.point4: Experiment with combinations in safer early rounds before depending on them

riskManagement.title: Advanced Risk Management
riskManagement.description: Expert CloverPit players know when to take calculated risks versus when to play conservatively. This CloverPit guide covers how this involves reading the game state and making smart decisions about charm purchases, spin timing, and when to commit resources.

assessment.title: Risk Assessment:
assessment.point1: Early rounds: Be conservative, focus on guaranteed value
assessment.point2: Mid rounds: Take calculated risks to accelerate your build
assessment.point3: Late rounds: Either you're winning handily or need risky plays to survive
assessment.point4: Know your "safety margin" - how much you can afford to lose and recover

charmSynergies.title: Powerful CloverPit Charm Synergies
charmSynergies.subtitle: These charm combinations featured in our CloverPit guide create especially powerful synergies. While specific charm names vary, these archetypes represent effective strategies for breaking the slot machine. For detailed charm information, visit our comprehensive wiki.

goldenEngine.title: Golden Symbol Amplification
goldenEngine.description: Merge charms that generate golden symbols with charms that amplify golden symbol rewards. Since golden symbols already provide enhanced payouts in CloverPit, multiplying their value creates exponential returns.
goldenEngine.combination: Golden Symbol Generator + Golden Reward Amplifier + Symbol Frequency Enhancer
goldenEngine.outcome: Consistently high-value spins with reduced variance

ticketLoop.title: Ticket Generation Cycle
ticketLoop.description: Accumulate ticket-producing charms alongside ticket amplifiers in CloverPit. Increased tickets lead to more charms, which generate additional tickets, establishing a self-perpetuating cycle of escalating power.
ticketLoop.combination: Ticket Reward Enhancer + Ticket Amplifier Charms + Economic Charms
ticketLoop.outcome: Rapidly expanding charm collection and unstoppable mid-game progression

cascadeChain.title: Cascade Trigger Chain
cascadeChain.description: The ultimate CloverPit combo: chain charms where each successful spin triggers additional effects, which trigger more effects, creating an avalanche of value from a single lever pull.
cascadeChain.combination: On-Win Trigger Charms + Multi-Effect Charms + Combo Multipliers
cascadeChain.outcome: Single spins that generate more value than entire early rounds

safetyNet.title: Safety Net Strategy
safetyNet.description: Build resilience in CloverPit with charms that provide minimum guarantees or safety mechanics. Perfect for players learning the game or attempting challenging seeds.
safetyNet.combination: Minimum Payout Guarantees + Debt Reduction Charms + Consistent Value Charms
safetyNet.outcome: Lower ceiling but much higher floor - consistent survival

symbolRecycling.title: Symbol Recycling Combo
symbolRecycling.description: Use charms that destroy low-value symbols and replace them with high-value ones in CloverPit. This "cleanses" the slot machine reels, improving every future spin's odds.
symbolRecycling.combination: Low Symbol Destroyer + High Symbol Creator + Symbol Persistence Charms
symbolRecycling.outcome: Increasingly favorable reel composition as the round progresses

highRoller.title: All-Or-Nothing High Roller
highRoller.description: For experienced CloverPit players: maximize variance with charms that amplify single symbol types to absurd degrees. Risky but can generate massive payouts when successful.
highRoller.combination: Single Symbol Focus + Maximum Multipliers + Symbol Guarantee Charms
highRoller.outcome: Extreme payouts but high failure risk - not for beginners

commonMistakes.title: Common CloverPit Mistakes to Avoid
commonMistakes.subtitle: Learn from these common errors that new CloverPit players make, as documented in our CloverPit guide. Avoiding these CloverPit mistakes will dramatically improve your survival rate. For more detailed analysis, check our strategy blog posts.

ticketExpenditure.title: Immediate Ticket Expenditure
ticketExpenditure.description: Novice CloverPit players frequently exhaust every ticket as soon as they acquire them. This approach leaves no financial buffer for superior charms in later vending machines or emergency acquisitions when builds require modification.
ticketExpenditure.solution: Maintain a ticket reserve equivalent to 2-3 rounds of earnings for operational flexibility.

charmInteractions.title: Overlooking Charm Interactions
charmInteractions.description: Acquiring random charms that appear appealing without considering their collaborative potential is a direct route to failure in CloverPit. Five disconnected charms are significantly weaker than 3 that work in harmony.
charmInteractions.solution: Select a strategic theme and acquire charms that reinforce that approach.

savingCharms.title: Saving Rechargeable Charms
savingCharms.description: Many CloverPit players hoard rechargeable charm uses "for the perfect moment." But these charms recharge between spins - use them liberally to maximize total value across the round.
savingCharms.solution: Use rechargeable abilities on cooldown unless you have a specific reason to wait.

phoneUpgrades.title: Neglecting Phone Upgrades
phoneUpgrades.description: The phone offers permanent upgrades between rounds in CloverPit, but players often choose randomly without considering their build. Poor upgrade choices compound into significant disadvantages.
phoneUpgrades.solution: Always choose phone upgrades that synergize with your current charm strategy.

rareSymbols.title: Chasing Rare Symbols
rareSymbols.description: Rare symbols in CloverPit pay more but appear infrequently. Building entirely around rare symbols means many spins generate nothing. Common symbols with multipliers are often more reliable.
rareSymbols.solution: Focus on moderately common symbols and multiply their value.

badRNG.title: Giving Up After Bad RNG
badRNG.description: Sometimes the CloverPit slot machine delivers terrible spins. Frustrated players make desperate decisions or give up mentally. But with proper charm building, you can recover from bad luck.
badRNG.solution: Stay calm, trust your build, and remember variance averages out over 3 spins.

endlessMode.title: CloverPit Endless Mode Guide
endlessMode.subtitle: Endless mode in CloverPit removes the finish line and tests how long you can survive against exponentially increasing debt. This CloverPit guide covers this mode for experienced players seeking ultimate challenges. Learn about all possible endings and outcomes to understand the full scope of the game.

mechanics.description: Endless mode in CloverPit functions distinctly from standard mode, featuring accelerated scaling and altered mechanics:

strategies.description: This CloverPit guide shows that succeeding in CloverPit endless mode requires fundamentally different approaches than standard mode:

strategy1.title: Prioritize Percentage Multipliers
strategy1.description: In endless CloverPit, flat bonuses become worthless as debt scales. Focus exclusively on percentage-based multipliers and scaling effects that grow with your economy.

strategy2.title: Build Exponential Engines
strategy2.description: The best endless mode CloverPit builds involve exponential scaling - charms that multiply other multipliers, creating compound growth that can theoretically scale infinitely.

strategy3.title: Optimize Every Decision
strategy3.description: In endless CloverPit runs, every ticket spent, every phone upgrade choice, and every charm purchase must be optimal. Small inefficiencies compound into run-ending disadvantages.

gameInfo.title: CloverPit Game Information
gameInfo.subtitle: Essential CloverPit Wiki details about CloverPit: The Descent

overview.title: CloverPit Wiki Game Overview
overview.description1: "LET'S GO GAMBLING - Now, let's roll" - CloverPit is a thrilling slot machine roguelike developed by Panik Arcade, an Italian indie studio. This CloverPit Wiki covers all aspects of CloverPit gameplay. Players must survive in a cell with a slot machine and ATM, earning coins through gambling to meet increasingly difficult quotas. The CloverPit Wiki documents over 150 unique charms, phone call systems, and various endings based on player choices.
overview.description2: CloverPit presents a unique blend of horror, gambling mechanics, and strategic gameplay that challenges players to master both luck and skill. This comprehensive CloverPit Wiki explores the game's atmospheric design that creates an immersive experience where every spin of the slot machine could mean the difference between survival and death. With its deep progression systems and multiple endings, CloverPit offers hours of replayability for those brave enough to face the cursed machine, and this CloverPit Wiki provides essential guidance for success.

releaseInfo.title: CloverPit Wiki Release Information
releaseInfo.description: The CloverPit DEMO version was released free of charge on Steam on April 10, 2025, with the official CloverPit release date on September 27, 2025. This CloverPit Wiki tracks the complete development timeline. Originally scheduled for September 3, 2025, the CloverPit Steam release was postponed due to the launch of HOLLOW KNIGHT: Silksong on the same day. The CloverPit Steam version has received positive reception from players who appreciate its unique take on the roguelike genre and innovative slot machine mechanics. Steam Clover Pit offers the complete gaming experience with full access to all CloverPit features and endings, and this CloverPit Wiki provides comprehensive coverage of all CloverPit content. Download the game to experience it yourself.

gameplayMechanics.title: CloverPit Wiki Core Gameplay

items.item1: Survive by meeting coin quotas within deadlines
items.item2: Use charms and phone upgrades to enhance slot machine performance
items.item3: Manage tickets as currency for purchasing charms
items.item4: Face exponential difficulty scaling as quotas increase
items.item5: Discover multiple endings based on strategic choices

gameplayMechanics.description: The CloverPit game's core loop revolves around the tension between risk and reward. This CloverPit Wiki explains how players must balance immediate survival needs with long-term strategic planning, making each decision crucial to their success. The slot machine serves as both your salvation and your potential downfall, requiring careful management of resources and timing. This CloverPit Wiki provides detailed strategies for mastering these CloverPit mechanics. For advanced strategies, check our comprehensive guide.

infoCards.releaseDateValue:
Early Access: April 10, 2025
Full CloverPit Release: September 27, 2025

characteristics.title: Game Characteristics
characteristics.description1: The goal is to earn money through gambling in a cell with a slot machine and deposit the quota into an ATM. However, as the game progresses, the required quota increases exponentially compared to the basic allowance multiplier, making it impossible to beat by simply playing a slot machine endlessly.
characteristics.description2: CloverPit's unique design philosophy combines elements of psychological horror with strategic gameplay. The game creates an atmosphere of isolation and desperation, where players must rely on their wits and luck to survive. The slot machine itself becomes a character in the story, representing both opportunity and danger. The game's difficulty curve is carefully designed to create tension while still allowing for strategic mastery.

deadlineMechanics.title: Deadline System
deadlineMechanics.description: If you do not deposit a certain amount of coins before passing the deadline by proceeding with the basic 3 rounds per deadline, the floor under your feet will open and you will fall to your death, ending the game. Players must match the amount by combining various items and increasing the multiples of symbols and arrangements.

items.item1: Demo Version: Fixed deadline at the 5th round (12,500 coins)
items.item2: Official Release: Amount gradually increases in stages
items.item3: Early Access: Game ends after clearing the 5th deadline
items.item4: Full Release: Obtain the Bloody Skull Key and escape (minimum unlockable at 9th deadline)

slotMachineMechanics.title: Slot Machine Mechanics
slotMachineMechanics.description1: The slot machine requires a small amount of coins to operate. When you have enough money, it's fixed to at least 3 times or up to 7 times. If you have insufficient funds, the number of spins is reduced according to your available amount, and if you have less than the minimum required, you get one free spin opportunity.
slotMachineMechanics.description2: When you reach the current maximum spin count, it resets to one minimum spin and awards two clover tickets.

atmSystem.title: ATM System
atmSystem.description: The ATM displays the coin amount needed to be earned by the deadline and shows how much has been deposited so far. It provides interest according to the deposited coins, creating an additional incentive for early deposits.

symbols.title: CloverPit Wiki Slot Machine Symbols
symbols.subtitle: This CloverPit Wiki section covers understanding CloverPit symbol values, probabilities, and strategic importance

specialSymbols.title: CloverPit Wiki Special Symbols
specialSymbols.description: This CloverPit Wiki section details the most important special symbols in CloverPit, including CloverPit 666 and CloverPit 999 mechanics.

number6.title: Number 6 (CloverPit 666)
number6.description: The most dangerous symbol with 1.5% probability (increased to 7% in demo based on progress). When three 6s align, you lose all coins earned in the current round. Can be defended with Bible or Rosary charms. When CloverPit 666 is activated, incoming calls become red phone calls. In official release, activating CloverPit 666 adds corpse charms to the drawer and creates strategic CloverPit 666 deck options. Essential for achieving the true CloverPit ending - you must answer red phone calls 3 times.

warning.title: Warning
warning.description: CloverPit 666 hitting in the last slot of the last round has a high risk of game over due to failure to settle the score. Even when using CloverPit 666 decks strategically, it remains a trap symbol that should never appear in normal CloverPit decks.

number9.title: Number 9 (CloverPit 999)
number9.unlockConditions: Complete normal ending + Skip 3 red calls
number9.description: Hidden symbol with unprecedented effects. Unlock requires: 1) Complete normal ending at least once, 2) Skip red phone calls from deadline #3 onwards (visible as CloverPit 666 floppy disks above slot machine), 3) Skip red phone calls 3 times total. When unlocked, 6 symbols are automatically replaced with 9s when spins stop. CloverPit 999 grants all coins from other symbols in the round and activates all CloverPit 666 charms. Transforms future phone calls to beneficial yellow options. Changes blood-red key to white skull key for complete CloverPit ending.

cherry.name: Cherry
cherry.description: The most common CloverPit symbol with 19.4% probability according to this CloverPit Wiki. If you get a golden variant early, the price increases rapidly, making it quite effective in CloverPit. This CloverPit Wiki notes that golden variant efficiency is lower in the second half. Used in stock decks and tarot decks using repeated occurrences and batteries rather than increasing the symbol value itself by utilizing high early probability. This CloverPit Wiki recommends this as a stable CloverPit symbol for beginners.

lemon.name: Lemon
lemon.description: Another most common CloverPit symbol with 19.4% probability as documented in this CloverPit Wiki. Works excellently with cherry-based strategies and provides consistent early CloverPit game income. This CloverPit Wiki explains that lemon is similar to cherry in that golden variants are highly effective early but lose efficiency in later CloverPit rounds.

clover.name: Clover
clover.description: CloverPit symbol with about 14.9% probability according to this CloverPit Wiki. The probability is somewhat ambiguous, making it strangely popular, but this CloverPit Wiki notes it's actually not bad if golden variants are picked up well early. In the official CloverPit edition, many effects linked to clover tickets around the CloverPit Symbol have been added, along with additional decks and Ticketer decks as documented in this CloverPit Wiki.

bell.name: Bell
bell.description: Similar to clover in value and probability in CloverPit. Often paired with other symbols in multi-symbol CloverPit strategies. The bell symbol represents good fortune and is commonly used in combination with other moderate-value CloverPit symbols.

diamond.name: Diamond
diamond.description: Higher value CloverPit symbol with 11.9% probability, similar to Seven but with different value and probability. Phone choices may affect all CloverPit symbols including Seven. In the official CloverPit release version, this symbol maintains its high value and strategic importance.

treasure.name: Treasure
treasure.description: Formerly called "Coin", now "Treasure" in the official CloverPit version. High value makes it worth building CloverPit strategies around. Similar to Diamond in value and probability, this CloverPit symbol represents accumulated wealth and is excellent for late-game CloverPit strategies.

seven.name: Seven
seven.description: CloverPit symbol with the lowest probability at 7.5%. Previously intertwined with diamonds and coins, but in the official CloverPit version, several options that assist Seven through telephone or talismans are treated separately. It's the best CloverPit symbol to aim for maximum value, but if you get buried too early, it's difficult to pass the early CloverPit stages.

patterns.title: CloverPit Wiki Pattern System
patterns.subtitle: This CloverPit Wiki explains CloverPit slot machine patterns and their multipliers. For detailed strategies on using these patterns, check our strategy guide.

jackpotSystem.title: CloverPit Wiki Jackpot System
jackpotSystem.description: This CloverPit Wiki documents that when multiple jackpots are triggered through charm effects, they receive special names:
jackpotSystem.note: Only the wording is different, but the rewards are all the same as the basic jackpot.

calculationRules.title: CloverPit Wiki Pattern Calculation Rules
calculationRules.description: This CloverPit Wiki section explains the complex pattern calculation rules that govern CloverPit gameplay mechanics.

patternHierarchy.title: Pattern Hierarchy
patternHierarchy.description: The lower pattern implied in a higher rating pattern is not calculated:

rules.rule2: Horizontal-XL: Horizontal-L and horizontal patterns are not calculated
rules.rule3: Zig, Zag: Diagonal pattern is not calculated
rules.rule4: Ground, Heaven: Ground doesn't activate Zig and Horizontal-XL (3 rows). Heaven doesn't activate Zag and Horizontal-XL (1 row)
rules.rule5: Eye: Lines 2 and 4 vertical patterns are not calculated

luckSystem.title: Luck System
luckSystem.description: Pattern appearance is determined by luck value:

rules.rule1: Luck 0: Patterns appear randomly with probability per symbol weight

luckSystem.calculationOrder: Calculation order: Luck probability â†’ Pattern establishment â†’ Symbol determination (proportional to weight)

rarity.title: CloverPit Wiki Rarity System
rarity.subtitle: This CloverPit Wiki covers CloverPit charm and phone call rarity levels

common.name: COMMON
common.description: Basic rarity that appears most frequently in CloverPit according to this CloverPit Wiki.
common.examples: Most basic CloverPit charms and phone call options documented in this CloverPit Wiki

uncommon.name: UNCOMMON
uncommon.description: 10% less frequent than Common rarity items in CloverPit as noted in this CloverPit Wiki.
uncommon.examples: CloverPit Crowbar, Hamsa, Calendar, Super Capacitor, Property Certificate - all documented in this CloverPit Wiki

mildlyRare.name: MILDLY RARE
mildlyRare.description: 20% less frequent than Common rarity items in CloverPit.
mildlyRare.examples: Various specialized CloverPit charms with moderate power

rare.name: RARE
rare.description: 35% less frequent than Common rarity items in CloverPit.
rare.examples: High-value CloverPit charms with significant effects

veryRare.name: VERY RARE
veryRare.description: 50% less frequent than Common rarity items in CloverPit.
veryRare.examples: CloverPit Pareidolia, Number One, Chastity Belt, Aa Batteries, Vorago, Barathrum

legendary.name: LEGENDARY
legendary.description: 65% less frequent than Common rarity items in CloverPit.
legendary.examples: Extremely powerful CloverPit charms with game-changing effects

ultraLegendary.name: ULTRA LEGENDARY
ultraLegendary.description: 80% less frequent than Common rarity items in CloverPit.
ultraLegendary.examples: CloverPit Electricity Meter, Music Tape, Dark Lotus, Swole Cat, Megaphone

phoneCalls.title: CloverPit Wiki Phone Call System
phoneCalls.subtitle: This CloverPit Wiki explores mysterious CloverPit phone calls that provide buffs and strategic options. Learn how to use these calls effectively in our strategy guide.

regularCalls.title: CloverPit Wiki Regular Phone Calls
regularCalls.description: This CloverPit Wiki section covers standard phone calls that provide various beneficial effects. Characterized by sarcastic or rebellious dialogue addressing gambling addiction.

redCalls.title: Red Phone Calls
redCalls.description: High-risk, high-reward phone calls that appear on deadlines 3 and 7, or after 666 activation. Provides answers that encourage continued gambling. Learn about the endings related to red phone calls.

yellowCalls.title: Yellow Phone Calls
yellowCalls.description: Exclusive positive phone calls unlocked by skipping 3 red phone calls. All options provide beneficial effects and unlock special content.

memoryCards.title: Memory Cards
memoryCards.subtitle: New feature in the official release. Learn how to use memory cards effectively in our strategy guide.

items.item1: Memory card packs float on the store ceiling after drawer release
items.item4: Pack rewards increase with each game condition met
items.item5: Can be used to apply special rules to new games

items.item1: Maintain phone chances and lucky enemies before collecting packs
items.item2: Memory cards can significantly alter game difficulty and mechanics
items.item3: Choose carefully which cards to use for optimal gameplay

difficultySystem.title: Difficulty System
difficultySystem.description: Naturally, the game is quite difficult, with deadlines divided according to luck and mechanisms that don't guarantee minimum combos depending on the deck, even if jackpots burst.

advancedStrategies.title: Advanced Strategies
advancedStrategies.description: Once you get used to the game, you can increase the odds and multipliers of specific symbols by combining items and phone messages:

cherryLemonStrategy.title: Cherry & Lemon Strategy
cherryLemonStrategy.description: Typical items related to cherries and lemons, which are the most common and often ignored by first-timers due to their low rewards, can be combined with items like pentacles, mushrooms, and stains. When combined properly, the money received increases exponentially with each spin, easily reaching billions in reserves by the end.

cloverTicketStrategy.title: Clover Ticket Strategy
cloverTicketStrategy.description: If you match clover ticket-related items well, it's not about item purchases, but the more you collect, the more you can spin. You can see that it continues to increase and the multipliers jump proportionally to the amount held.

endingsSystem.title: CloverPit Wiki Game Endings System
endingsSystem.description: This CloverPit Wiki documents that CloverPit features multiple CloverPit endings based on player choices and strategic decisions throughout the CloverPit game. The CloverPit Wiki provides comprehensive coverage of all ending paths. For detailed walkthroughs, visit our endings page.

normalEnding.title: Normal Ending

items.item1: Complete the game by meeting all deadlines
items.item3: Escape from the cell (minimum unlockable at 9th deadline)

normalEnding.description: The standard ending where you successfully escape from the cursed slot machine cell. This ending unlocks the ability to access the true ending path.

trueEnding.title: True Ending

items.item1: Complete normal ending at least once
items.item2: Skip red phone calls 3 times total
items.item4: Obtain the White Skull Key instead of Bloody Skull Key

trueEnding.description: The complete CloverPit ending where you transcend the cursed system entirely. Unlocks the CloverPit 999 symbol and transforms all phone calls to beneficial yellow options. Changes the final key from blood-red to white skull.

gameOver.title: Game Over

items.item1: Fail to meet coin quota by deadline
items.item2: The floor opens and you fall to your death

gameOver.description: The standard failure state. However, each death unlocks meta-progression content and brings you closer to understanding the game's deeper mechanics.

demoEnding.title: Demo Ending

items.item1: Clear the game by the 5th deadline (12,500 coins)

demoEnding.description: The simplified ending available in the demo version. Fixed deadline at the 5th round with a straightforward victory condition.

charmSystem.title: CloverPit Wiki Charm System
charmSystem.description: This CloverPit Wiki explains that the CloverPit charm system is the core of CloverPit's strategic gameplay, featuring over 150 unique CloverPit charms with various effects and synergies. The CloverPit Wiki provides detailed information about charm mechanics and strategies.

items.item1: Charm Capacity: Players can possess up to 7 charms by default
items.item2: Purchase Currency: Clover Tickets are used to buy charms from vending machines
items.item3: Charm Shop: 4 random charms available with restock button
items.item4: Capacity Modifiers: Certain charms or phone calls can increase/decrease capacity
items.item5: Characteristics: Charms can gain special characteristics through phone calls

charmSynergies.title: Charm Synergies
charmSynergies.description: Charms work best when combined strategically:

items.item1: Economy Charms: Boost coin generation and ticket income
items.item2: Symbol Enhancement: Increase specific symbol values or probabilities
items.item3: Pattern Amplification: Enhance pattern multipliers and jackpot values
items.item4: Utility Effects: Provide defensive options like Bible/Rosary for 666 protection
items.item5: Meta Effects: Influence luck, spin counts, and game mechanics

items.item1: Start with economy-focused charms for early game stability
items.item2: Build synergies around 2-3 core symbols rather than spreading too thin
items.item3: Consider phone call characteristics when planning charm combinations
items.item4: Save tickets for premium vending machines with better charm selection
items.item5: Adapt your strategy based on available charms rather than forcing specific builds

hero.title: CloverPit Endings Guide
hero.description: Master the art of escaping CloverPit with this comprehensive CloverPit Endings guide to all CloverPit ending types, including the true CloverPit ending and sacred trinkets. This CloverPit Endings guide covers every CloverPit ending path and CloverPit ending strategy available in the game. For more game information, visit our homepage or check out our strategy guide.

preparation.title: CloverPit Ending Preparation
preparation.subtitle: Essential preparation steps before attempting any CloverPit ending. This CloverPit ending guide covers all necessary preparation for successful CloverPit ending achievement. For detailed game mechanics, check our comprehensive wiki.

drawerSlots.title: CloverPit Ending Drawer Slots Collection
drawerSlots.description1: Before attempting any CloverPit ending, you must ensure that you have obtained all your drawer slots, as these will be needed to store the corpse pieces for your run. This preparation requires drawer slots earned by reaching certain deadlines during your CloverPit runs. The important detail is that once you have obtained a key for a particular run, you cannot get another one in that same run, which means this preparation will require at least 3 separate CloverPit runs to complete.
drawerSlots.description2: The drawer system is crucial for CloverPit ending preparation. Each drawer slot represents a potential storage location for corpse pieces, and having all slots available gives you the maximum flexibility when planning your run. The slots are earned progressively as you reach higher deadlines, making them a natural reward for advancing through CloverPit's difficulty curve and preparing for your ending attempt.

corpsePieces.title: CloverPit Ending Corpse Pieces Setup
corpsePieces.description1: The key to starting your CloverPit ending run with corpse pieces lies in how you end your previous run. If you want to guarantee that you start with all the corpse pieces (excluding the skull, which is found randomly in the shop), you must ensure that when you end a CloverPit run, all your drawers are filled with items. These items will then transform into corpse pieces in your next run, giving you a significant advantage from the start.
corpsePieces.description2: For example, if your last CloverPit run had two trinkets in the bottom two drawers (as shown in the reference image), you will be able to start your next run with 2 out of 4 corpse pieces already in place. This preparation method is much more reliable than trying to obtain corpse pieces during the actual run, as the criteria for gaining them mid-run is unclear and can add unnecessary complexity to an already challenging endeavor.
corpsePieces.description3: If your drawers are empty and you want to quickly fill them before starting a corpse run, you can use the "Cold Affection" memory card. This card allows you to buy 4 items and then restart, effectively giving you a quick way to populate your drawers without committing to a full run. Learn more about memory cards and game mechanics in our wiki.

skullAcquisition.title: CloverPit Ending Skull Acquisition
skullAcquisition.description1: The skull is the easiest component to obtain for your CloverPit ending preparation, as it appears as a common rarity item in the shop. This makes it relatively straightforward to find during your run, and it's even better if you can find one with a modifier attached. The skull's common status means you don't need to worry too much about finding it, unlike the more complex preparation required for the other corpse pieces.
skullAcquisition.description2: Once you have all your drawer slots unlocked, your corpse pieces prepared, and a clear understanding of where to find the skull, you'll have everything you need to attempt either of the two main CloverPit endings. This preparation phase is essential for success, as starting without these advantages makes the runs significantly more difficult.

badEnding.title: Obtaining the CloverPit Bad Ending
badEnding.subtitle: The straightforward path to escape CloverPit, but not the true CloverPit ending victory. This CloverPit ending guide covers the bad ending path. For advanced strategies, check our comprehensive guide.

simplePath.title: CloverPit Bad Ending Simple Path
simplePath.description1: Obtaining the CloverPit bad ending is relatively straightforward compared to the more complex good ending. This process involves playing through CloverPit normally and reaching a specific coin quota. For the standard bad ending, you need to accumulate 250,000 coins. However, if you're using the "Delusions of grandeur" memory card, this requirement doubles to 500,000 coins.
simplePath.description2: Once you reach the required coin quota, CloverPit will unlock the dark key, which serves as your ticket to freedom. With this key in hand, you can proceed to the exit located behind you in your cell and leave the cursed CloverPit slot machine behind forever. This process is intentionally simple, representing the path of least resistance - a quick escape rather than a true understanding or mastery of CloverPit's deeper mechanics required for the true ending.

rewards.title: CloverPit Bad Ending Rewards and Consequences
rewards.description1: Successfully completing the CloverPit bad ending will grant you the game credits, marking the end of your journey through CloverPit. Additionally, the memory card you used during the run will receive a rainbow border effect, though it's worth noting that this effect is not fully holographic and represents a lesser achievement compared to what's possible with other strategies.
rewards.description2: While the CloverPit bad ending does provide a sense of completion and allows you to escape the cursed machine, it's important to understand that this is considered the "bad" ending for a reason. It represents taking the easy way out without truly engaging with CloverPit's more complex systems and deeper mysteries. CloverPit clearly communicates that there are much more rewarding conclusions available for players who are willing to put in the additional effort and take on the more challenging path to the true ending. Learn about the game's deeper mechanics to understand why the true ending is more rewarding.
rewards.description3: The CloverPit bad ending serves as both an achievement and a stepping stone. It proves you can survive and escape CloverPit, but it also hints at the greater rewards and deeper satisfaction that come from pursuing the more challenging good ending path. This guide recommends the bad ending as a starting point before attempting the true ending.

goodEnding.title: Obtaining the CloverPit Good Ending (+ Sacred Trinkets)
goodEnding.subtitle: The true path to CloverPit victory and sacred trinkets. This CloverPit ending guide covers the complete good ending strategy. For detailed strategies, check our comprehensive guide.

memoryCard.title: CloverPit Good Ending Memory Card Recommendation
memoryCard.description1: For achieving the CloverPit good ending, I strongly recommend using the 'Heartbreak' memory card. This choice is strategic because it guarantees that you will get at least one CloverPit 666 pattern during your run, which is absolutely essential for the transformation process. The CloverPit 666 pattern serves as a crucial trigger that forces your next phone call to be red, and without this pattern, you'll find yourself unable to complete the necessary steps for the good ending.
memoryCard.description2: The Heartbreak memory card's ability to ensure a CloverPit 666 pattern is invaluable because it removes one of the most unpredictable elements from your strategy. Without this guarantee, you would be relying on random chance to roll the CloverPit 666 pattern, which could require multiple attempts and significantly extend your preparation time. By using Heartbreak, you can plan your run with confidence, knowing that you'll have access to the red phone calls needed for the transformation sequence.

phoneCalls.title: CloverPit Good Ending Phone Call Rules and Restrictions
phoneCalls.description1: The most critical rule for achieving the CloverPit good ending is that you must never take any phone calls that contain red text and feature a lower-pitched voice. These calls represent the corrupted or dangerous communications that will prevent the transformation from occurring. You can identify these forbidden calls by their distinctive red text color and the noticeably deeper, more menacing voice tone.
phoneCalls.description2: However, you are allowed to take calls from other sources or ignore them entirely if you prefer. The key distinction is specifically avoiding the red-text calls with the lower pitch. Additionally, opening the menu during calls is perfectly fine - you can simply hit "Be right back" and not return to the call, which counts as avoiding the forbidden communication.
phoneCalls.description3: This restriction is part of CloverPit's deeper narrative about choosing the right path and avoiding the temptations that lead to corruption. By consistently rejecting the red calls, you demonstrate your commitment to the purer path that leads to the true ending. This guide emphasizes the importance of this phone call discipline. Learn more about phone call mechanics in our wiki.

floppyDisk.title: CloverPit Good Ending 666 Floppy Disk System
floppyDisk.description1: The CloverPit ending transformation process centers around the CloverPit 666 floppy disk, which acts as a tracking mechanism for your progress toward the CloverPit good ending. Each time you finish a deadline that had a red phone call (which you correctly avoided), you will receive one mark on your CloverPit 666 floppy disk. This CloverPit ending system requires you to accumulate exactly three marks before the CloverPit ending transformation can occur.
floppyDisk.description2: The CloverPit ending process works as follows: First, you finish a deadline that featured a red phone call (which you avoided), earning your first mark. You then repeat this process two more times, each time avoiding the red calls and completing the deadline. Once you have accumulated three marks on your CloverPit 666 floppy disk, you take one more phone call - this time, the phone will transform and begin offering holy calls instead of the regular communications for your CloverPit ending.
floppyDisk.description3: This three-strike system represents a test of patience and discipline in CloverPit ending strategies. It requires you to consistently make the right choices over multiple deadlines, proving your worthiness for the CloverPit ending transformation. The CloverPit 666 floppy disk serves as both a progress tracker and a symbolic representation of your journey toward enlightenment in CloverPit ending achievement.

transformation.title: CloverPit Good Ending Transformation and Its Benefits
transformation.description1: Once you have successfully accumulated three marks on your CloverPit 666 floppy disk, your next phone call will be holy in nature. This CloverPit ending transformation affects multiple aspects of the game simultaneously. The phone itself transforms, now offering holy calls instead of regular or red calls. These holy calls provide access to sacred charms, which are powerful items that can significantly enhance your CloverPit ending gameplay experience.
transformation.description2: More importantly, the CloverPit ending transformation also affects the key that you use to exit the room. When you use this transformed key on the door, it will unlock the true CloverPit ending, providing a much more satisfying and complete conclusion to your journey through CloverPit. This represents the reward for your patience, discipline, and commitment to the proper path in CloverPit ending strategies.
transformation.description3: The CloverPit ending transformation sequence is the culmination of all your preparation and careful decision-making. It represents CloverPit's way of rewarding players who choose to engage with its deeper mechanics and pursue the more challenging but ultimately more rewarding path to CloverPit ending victory.

tips.title: CloverPit Ending Tips & Tricks
tips.subtitle: Advanced CloverPit ending strategies and important details for CloverPit ending success. This CloverPit ending guide provides expert tips. For more strategies, check our community blog.

threeStrikes.title: CloverPit Ending Getting Your 3 Strikes
threeStrikes.description1: To successfully complete the transformation process, you need to obtain all three strikes on your CloverPit 666 floppy disk. This requires careful planning and understanding of CloverPit's mechanics. The key insight is that you must obtain at least one 'CloverPit 666' pattern during your run, as this pattern forces your next phone call to be red, providing you with the third strike opportunity.
threeStrikes.description2: Without the CloverPit 666 pattern, you will only be able to get 2 red phone calls by deadline 8, as the other two red calls are guaranteed to appear on deadline 3 and deadline 7. This means you would fall short of the required three strikes, making the transformation impossible. The CloverPit 666 pattern is therefore not just helpful but absolutely essential for achieving the good ending.
threeStrikes.description3: This is why the Heartbreak memory card is so valuable - it guarantees that you will roll at least one CloverPit 666 pattern, ensuring that you have access to all three strike opportunities. Without this guarantee, you would be relying on random chance, which could require multiple attempts and significantly extend your preparation time. Learn more about memory cards and patterns in our wiki.

timing.title: CloverPit Ending Timing and Deadline Strategy
timing.description1: Understanding the timing of red phone calls is crucial for planning your strategy. CloverPit has a predictable pattern for when these calls appear, and knowing this schedule allows you to plan your approach accordingly.
timing.description2: Red phone calls are guaranteed to appear on deadline 3 and deadline 7 in CloverPit. These represent your first two opportunities to earn strikes on your CloverPit 666 floppy disk. However, to get the third strike, you need to trigger an additional red call through the CloverPit 666 pattern. This means you need to roll the CloverPit 666 pattern before deadline 8 to ensure you have enough time to complete the transformation process.
timing.description3: The timing becomes even more important when you consider that you need to avoid taking the red calls while still completing the deadlines that feature them in CloverPit. This requires careful balance - you need the red calls to appear so you can earn strikes, but you must resist the temptation to answer them. The CloverPit 666 pattern helps by providing a guaranteed third red call opportunity, making the timing more predictable and manageable.

sacredTrinkets.title: CloverPit Ending Sacred Trinkets and Holy Calls
sacredTrinkets.description1: Once you have successfully completed the transformation process, the phone will begin offering holy calls instead of regular or red calls. These holy calls are exclusive to the good ending path and provide access to sacred charms, which are among the most powerful items in CloverPit.
sacredTrinkets.description2: Sacred charms offer significant gameplay advantages and represent the ultimate reward for successfully navigating the complex transformation process. These items are not available through any other means and serve as a tangible benefit for choosing the more challenging but ultimately more rewarding path to the good ending.
sacredTrinkets.description3: The holy calls themselves also represent a thematic shift in CloverPit's narrative. Where regular calls might offer mundane rewards and red calls represent corruption or danger, holy calls provide access to items that align with the purer, more enlightened path you've chosen to pursue. This creates a cohesive experience where your choices throughout CloverPit directly impact the rewards and opportunities available to you.
